devdoc.details: Contract that distributes rewards to users based on a merkle proof that is computed offchain and updated on a regular basis by the admin. The contract assumes that rewardToken balance will be transferred directly by the program creator. The merkle root can be updated by the admin only if block.timestamp >= _timeElapsedForUpdate. Rewards will be claimed on a first come first serve basis until the total amount claimed is less than the cap set for the ongoing epoch. Admin can reclaim unused rewards after a certain amount of inactivity

params.amount: The amount that can be claimed by msg.sender.
params.proof: The merkle proof for msg.senders distribution.

params._timeElapsedForUpdate: The time after which the next distribution can be updated.
params._timeToReclaimRewards: The time after which an admin can claim unused rewards.
params.rewardTokenAddress: address of the token that will be used to pay rewards.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params.account: The address of the account to which the unused tokens need to be transferred.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params._maxAmountToClaim: Total amount of tokens that can be claimed during an epoch.
params._merkleRoot: The merkleRoot of the reward distribution.

updateTimeElapsedForUpdate(uint256).details: don't allow to update unless previous time has passed

params._timeToReclaimRewards: new timeToReclaimRewards value. TODO: admin can manipulate this, add a check on times

epochNonce.details: as a merkle root update is needed to start the rewards, the initial nonce is 1

MerkleRootUpdated(bytes32,uint256).notice: Emitted when the merkle root is updated.

amountClaimed().notice: the number of tokens claimed in a given epoch.

claimReward(bytes32[],uint256).notice: Users can claim the rewards allocated to them.

lastUpdated().notice: The time when the merkleRoot was updated.

lastUpdatedTimeElapsed().notice: The time when the timeElapsedForUpdate was updated.

maxAmountToClaim().notice: The maximum amount of tokens that can be claimed in a given epoch.

merkleRoot().notice: The merkle root of the distribution for the current epoch.

merkleRootAdmin().notice: Address that can update the merkle root

reclaimUnusedReward(address).notice: Allows admin to reclaim unused rewards after a period of inactivity.

rewardToken().notice: Address of the token used to give rebates.

timeElapsedForUpdate().notice: The time after which the merkle root can be updated.

timeToReclaimRewards().notice: the time after which an admin can claim unused rewards.
